poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: The face in the snapshot tacked to the board was tracked down. The hand behind the print on the thumb-tack tapped his phone and trapped him. Tamped in a cell or cellar the monotony tramped him flat; He was tasked with this and taxed with that but tact, As in finesse, was not his thing: The tract he'd hammered out theyâ€™d hauled him in for? It was tit-for-tat stuff any twat could do. Yet to deceive Is not a piece of tart or a meringue. He'd have had to practice. He just got tanked and trashed the place.
